author: Jerreke
title: good value for money
review:
I purchased this set for my 4-year old son. He already plays with the large police helicopter 4439 but lacked a 'bad guy' and a smaller vehicle for police/bad guy.

This set has it al: 2 minifigs, 2 vehicles, a small building, extra's to make a small helicopter and some idea's on the box art.

Pros

  • 2 minifigs: bad guy and police-officer
  • 2 vehicles
  • extra parts
  • straightforward construction
  • ideas on box

Cons

  • none: given the price.

Given the price (9 €) it offers great value and playability. It is ideal for smaller children and afterwards it offers two extra vehicles to populate the streets of a lego-city :)

author: Falcon_Knight
title: Great Value, especially if you are getting a city started
review:
I got this set at the Lego store because I needed a gate to my city and I didn't save enough to buy the Escape From Dragon's Prison. I regret not buying it, but I do not regret buying this. It's cheap, has decent minifigs, and has a cell door. Those who are getting started with their collection, buy this set.

…

Parts

Most of the parts are nothing special, though there are a few nice parts. The helicopter rotor, the prison door, and a 8 wheels.

…

Minifigures

The minifigures are a lot like last year's, though I was a bit confused by the green pants. They now are on a garbage driver. :)

…

The build

The build is pretty easy, no annoying stickers, so what you would expect from Bricks&More.

…

The completed model

The model is a bit basic, but a welcome addition to any [modern-day] collection. It's playable, unlike the Lasha's Byte Cycle (which I will review soon, there are no other reviews), sturdy, and easy to build.

…

Summary

Let's make this brief. Read the title, great set for only $10 USD, and good for smaller children, because it's easy and sturdy, although the quad looks blocky.

…
